posts.post_content:
I absolutely love this card, but not for what it does in games of magic. I love it for the comedy it provides the experienced magic community, and for their entertainment (and mine) here are some of the best quotes MTG newbies have to offer,  
  
"only 3 mana? if needs to add AT LEAST 10 mana to be of any use" - Kroen  
  
"IT'S CARD DISADVANTAGE, IT SUCKS" - MetalCrisis  
  
"Best Card Ever Next To BaneWasp Affliction" - MasterOfEtherium  
  
"Not the best card ever...that's ancestral vision...but amazing nonetheless!" - Peaceout734  
  
"O\_o The thought of being able to get my Akroma out on turn one blows my mind   
5/5   
For a card that opens doors to victory" - Eved (little closed minded...)  
  
And the best quote...  
"This is a pretty good card, but its not worth the hype. Worse than Dark Ritual because it dies to shatter." BalonyPony  
Oh and Dark Ritual dies to Negate :P

posts.post_content: One of the most powerful cards ever obviously, possibly THE most powerful. But as with [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual), it's how the rest of the deck is geared up to take advantage of it that makes the difference between 'just' extremely powerful and actively, unfairly broken...
posts.html:
One of the most powerful cards ever obviously, possibly THE most powerful. But as with Dark Ritual, it's how the rest of the deck is geared up to take advantage of it that makes the difference between 'just' extremely powerful and actively, unfairly broken...

Posted By: stygimoloch (12/5/2008 7:43:38 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It may not be the most degenerate card ever printed (Academy), and it may not cause the opponent to scoop if resolved (Yawgmoth's Will), but there's something to be said about a card whose weaker versions are still overpowered.  
  
If you're skilled enough to build the almost non-existent deck that's not improved by adding Black Lotus, you already know why it's the best card in Magic.
posts.html:
It may not be the most degenerate card ever printed (Academy), and it may not cause the opponent to scoop if resolved (Yawgmoth's Will), but there's something to be said about a card whose weaker versions are still overpowered.

If you're skilled enough to build the almost non-existent deck that's not improved by adding Black Lotus, you already know why it's the best card in Magic.

Posted By: Mooby (9/15/2009 4:14:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
When I was first learning how to play the game, I asked my friends, who were already hardcore players, "what is the best card ever?" They looked at each other "Black Lotus," they said. They told me what it did, and I was like, "Okay whatever." Then I thought about it. I thought about it hard. I blacked out, and awoke in a forest with my face covered in blood, and ever since then, wolves seemed to bow at my feet.  
  
Suffice to say, This is a pretty good card.
posts.html:
When I was first learning how to play the game, I asked my friends, who were already hardcore players, "what is the best card ever?" They looked at each other "Black Lotus," they said. They told me what it did, and I was like, "Okay whatever." Then I thought about it. I thought about it hard. I blacked out, and awoke in a forest with my face covered in blood, and ever since then, wolves seemed to bow at my feet.

Suffice to say, This is a pretty good card.

Posted By: Hambot (11/13/2008 8:13:39 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: People that find a fault with the playability of this card don't have a full grasp of the game. Even if you don't draw it until mid-game it's a big mana boost. When you DO draw it in your first hand it can't kill your opponent by itself, but it is THE KEY to many first turn kills. When judging this card put it in the context in which it was created. Look at the Alpha, Beta, or Unlimited lists and see the limited # of cards that actually existed then. Magic is really just a death race and this baby is the king of speed.
posts.html:

Look at the Alpha, Beta, or Unlimited lists and see the limited # of cards that actually existed then. Magic is really just a death race and this baby is the king of speed.

posts.post_content: Like it or not, Magic is fundamentally a race to win; the Black Lotus gives you a 3 turn head start on your opponent in this race. Furthermore, it is not restricted to any particular color of deck. Anyone who doesn't like the Lotus has probably never had the chance to play with one.
posts.html:
Like it or not, Magic is fundamentally a race to win; the Black Lotus gives you a 3 turn head start on your opponent in this race. Furthermore, it is not restricted to any particular color of deck. Anyone who doesn't like the Lotus has probably never had the chance to play with one.

Posted By: B1indFremen (5/13/2009 10:53:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not bad... Not bad at all... To my knowledge, this little sucker could improve almost any deck. Its only problem is that it's not game ending in any way. It will set you up, absolutely. If, however, its not in your first hand, it's likely to be of little use.  
  
Usually empty my hand relatively fast and I need very little manna to function, so if I drew it latter in the game I doubt I would use it. Then, even if it is in the first hand, you need something big enough to use with it, but not so big that you can't...  
  
The problem with this is actually quite the opposite problem that many cards have. A lot of cards I have seen need an entire deck structured around them to function... This one on the other hand cant combo with anything, at all. Its just a matter of you drawing it at the right time: early.  
  
base rating: \*\*\*  
  
easiest manna to get in the game: +\*\*  
In possible to structure around: -\*  
  
A pity... and supposedly the best magic card ever, and defiantly the most valuable... it dose ha... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
